content: NeuroViz is an interactive platform designed to visualize and understand deep learning model predictions using advanced explainability techniques.

trigger: What can I do on this website?
content: You can upload images, select models, and explore explainability methods like Grad-CAM, LIME, SHAP, and Saliency Maps to see how AI makes decisions.

trigger: What machine learning models are available?
content: NeuroViz supports MobileNet, ResNet, and VGG16 for making predictions and explaining their outputs.
The platform works with popular datasets such as MNIST, CIFAR-10, and ImageNet, allowing users to test models on real-world data.
NeuroViz provides multiple explainability methods including Grad-CAM, LIME and Saliency Maps.
Grad-CAM highlights the most important regions in an image that influenced a model’s decision by generating a heatmap overlay.
LIME (Local Interpretable Model-agnostic Explanations) generates perturbed versions of an image and analyzes how the model’s predictions change to identify important features.

trigger: How does the Saliency Map method work?
content: Saliency Maps highlight the pixels in an image that have the highest impact on the model’s prediction, giving insights into feature importance.
Absolutely! The platform is designed for both AI enthusiasts and researchers, with an intuitive UI and easy-to-understand explanations.

trigger: Is there a GitHub repository for this project?
content: Yes, you can find the source code on our GitHub repository. [Insert GitHub Link Here]
